results.title: The Little island
results.creator_credit: Richard Williams Films and Richard Williams
results.brief_description: An animated film exploring the potential for conflict between different views of life and its possible consequences. Three inhabitants of an island clash repeatedly over their respective devotion to the good, the true and the beautiful. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: The Little giraffe
results.brief_description: A charming cast of animated toys moves through a miniature town with comic inventiveness to seek first-aid for a sadly deflated toy giraffe at a gas station air pump.

results.title: The Little Frenchman
results.brief_description: Roger was a widower with no living relatives or close friends. His life experiences placed him in both world wars and post war migration. This is his story.

results.title: The Little foxes
results.creator_credit: Samuel Goldwyn, RKO Radio Pictures, Goldwyn Productions, William Wyler and Orry-Kelly
results.brief_description: Based on the stage play by renown author Lillian Hellman, Bette Davis gives an extraordinary performance as Regina, an avaricious wife who will stop at nothing to outwit her brothers in controlling the family business. The cost of this greed results in the death of her ailing husband, Herbert Marshall and rejection by her daughter played by Teresa Wright. Nominated for nine Academy Awards, the acting in this production is flawless, and the story is filled with drama and suspense. The Hubbard family of the “Deep South” remain one of the most greedy and rapacious family’s bought to the screen.

results.title: The Little Drummer Girl
results.creator_credit: Robert L. Crawford, Warner Bros Pictures and George Roy Hill
results.brief_description: Diane Keaton stars as Charlie, an American actress and Palestinian sympathiser. Klaus Kinski is the head of an Israeli counterspy group who sees Charlie’s romantic vulnerability as the perfect trap for the elusive Palestinian terrorist Khalil. Based on the novel by John Le Carre.

results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios and Cynthia Freitag

results.title: The Little convict
results.creator_credit: Yoram Gross Films, Yoram Gross and Sandra Gross
results.brief_description: In old New South Wales a new batch of convicts arrives including the little convict, young Toby Nelson. Consigned to a Government farm they are subjected to the cruelty of their tyrannical overseers, Sergeant Billy Langden and Corporal Weazel Wesley, finally resulting in the death of the pickpocket, Old Dipper. Toby escapes and flees into the alien Australian bush where he is saved from death by the aboriginal boy Wahroonga. Together with another escapee, highwayman Jack Doolan, and Wahroonga’s animal friends, they launch a spectacular mission to rescue the blacksmith Big George and Toby’s sister Polly. With Rolf Harris as a storyteller and the magic of live action and animation, this wonderful Australian historical adventure comes joyously to life.

results.title: The Little Colonel
results.creator_credit: David Butler, B G De Sylva Productions and Fox Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Shirley Temple collection”.
After a blistery Southern Colonel (Lionel Barrymore) banishes his daughter (Evelyn Venable) for marrying a Northener (John Lodge), he refuses to see her even when she returns years later with her young daughter (Shirley Temple). As outspoken as her grandfather, the ingenious child turns on plenty of charm and wins his heart. Includes a remarkable tap dance/soft-shoe routine with the famous Bill “Mr Bojangles” Robinson. In a role she makes her own, Hattie McDaniel of “Gone with the wind” fame, plays Mammy. The original production was in black and white, with the final scene shot in technicolor, however this version has been computer colourised.

results.title: The little chimney sweep
results.creator_credit: Richard Kaplan, Louis Hagen, Primrose Productions and Lotte Reiniger
results.brief_description: An example of Lotte Reiniger’s early silhouette films, re-cut and given a new sountrack. Tells the tale of a little chimney sweep from 18th century London who comes down the wrong chimney and meets a rich young heiress.
